body: One more comment on this. If we want to allow the default compression level of the `Deflater` to set, we also need to change the constructor of the `JdkZlibEncoder` since right now it checks a range from `0` to `9`.
@daschl honestly I can't remember why we used this value. Maybe @trustin remembers ?

I don't remember the exact detail since it was written long time ago, but according to [zlib manual](https://www.zlib.net/manual.html):

> The compression level must be Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION, or between 0 and 9: 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression, 0 gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time). Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION requests a default compromise between speed and compression (currently equivalent to level 6).
I think we can make a change so it accepts `-1` as the default.
Another more conservative approach we could as a first step is to allow at least `-1` as a value being passed in? than it is backwards compatible and users who want to set -1 can do so.
@daschl sounds like a plan... Please send over a PR

issue.title: Make JdkZlibEncoder accept Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION as level

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:
Right now the default compression level inside the used Deflater is defined as "-1", which according to zlib manual also defaults to "6" which is used inside netty as the default. That said, we should also allow to provide Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION (-1) as an argument.

Modifications:
The range check has been modified to allow for -1 and it now uses the constants instead of magic numbers. Small regression test added which just makes sure that no exception is thrown when provided.

Result:
Fixes #15212
